text: [Music]
well first of all um most people think
that you know people spend a lot of time
in Beijing with the central government
because they think okay the way China
Works is you've got these guys up top in
Beijing and then whatever they say kind
of goes into the provinces in the cities
that actually doesn't work that way
China is actually very decentralized and
so while you can have these great Rel
relationships in Beijing which can maybe
help you in some way or another they
never really get you to where you want
to go what you really need to do is
develop those relationships the local
level so today I would spend very little
almost no time with the central
government very little time with the
provincial governments would spend all
my times with governments with the local
governments so we got 17 factories in
eight different provinces in China we
tend to be in a lot of the inner
provinces and a lot of the smaller
cities in China we tend to be one of the
best Employers in that city so we become
very important to that City and I'm a
big proponent of the big fish in a
little Pond Theory where if you go to a
city of 600,000 people which here would
be a big city there it's a small City if
you go there and you're the best
employer in town you get a lot of
attention from the local government and
so what we've learned to do over the
years is to really first of all make
sure the local government understands
everything that we're doing and what
we're doing is good for the community
and then working with them and and uh
and you'd be surprised how much they can
help you I can you know our piston ring
business is located in a city called e
Jun which is about four hours you know
from Shanghai and every time I go to the
party secretary comes out to meet me and
takes me to dinner this one time I went
there he couldn't wait to see me he
couldn't wait to take me to dinner to
tell me that they've been working for
six months to get our joint venture a
two or three million uh tax refund
I didn't even know you none of our
people really knew that we were eligible
for it they didn't tell us they were
working on it but they just went ahead
for six months to get it because they
thought it'd be good for the joint
venture and of that money that came back
two-thirds of it came from the
provincial government but one third came
from the city's pocket so they actually
turned back money that um you know they
had taken you know rightfully so in
taxes and they got it back to us by some
you know special tax refund provision
that just blew me away because here they
didn't tell us about it we didn't know
they were doing it we didn't ask them to
do it but they knew it would be good for
the joint venture if they could get us
you know that money so that's the kind
of relationships that we've been able to
develop and that's what's possible in
China
